messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom]Unschooling, Clarity & directness
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 2/11/01 12:19:15 PM, hearthome@home.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 2/11/01 12:19:15 PM, hearthome@... writes:

<< I really enjoyed reading your post on this. Are you planning on ever
writing a book on unschooling, with more of your personal story included? >>

Yes. Pretty much it's written. I had a computer die on me, and the files
have been copied from an old-old computer, and sent to a friend in Las Cruces
who has put them on a CD to send them back to me so I can get them into my
new iMac (which doesn't take floppy disks). (Sounds SO much like "the dog
age it" doesn't it?)

Thanks for the encouragement and kind words.

I used to have a title idea, but I forgot what it was. I guess it wasn't too
brilliant, if it slipped my mind.

Sandra

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom]Unschooling, Clarity & directness
messages.msgSnippet: ... I really enjoyed reading your post on this. Are you planning on ever writing a book on unschooling, with more of your personal story included?  The
messages.messageBody:
Dear Sandra,


I really enjoyed reading your post on this. Are you planning on ever writing a book on unschooling, with more of your personal story included?  The Unschooling Handbook is good, but a book written of an actual family's experience would be wonderful.  Plus, a book with your directness and vision hasn't been written yet. Are you considering writing one, by chance... please??
 

--
Sandi in VA
"Home is where the HEART is!"

"What is most important and valuable about the home as a base for
children's growth into the world is not that it is a better school than
the schools,but that it isn't a school at all."
     John Holt
